title: Error codes
content:
# Error codes 2021-05-09 18:43 If an error occurs when you call an API, an error response is returned, where [the `result` object](https://miniprogram.gcash.com/docs/miniprogram_gcash/mpdev-old/xxpbkg#GN2yb) indicates the error code (`resultCode`) and error message (`resultMessage`). You can use error codes and messages to troublshoot issues. Error codes are usually classified into the following categories: - [Common error codes](https://miniprogram.gcash.com/docs/miniprogram_gcash/mpdev-old/error_codes#oyy9K): are common for all Mini Program OpenAPIs. - [API-specific error codes](https://miniprogram.gcash.com/docs/miniprogram_gcash/mpdev-old/error_codes#yXcm4): are dedicated to a specific OpenAPI. # Common error codes The following table lists all common error codes for Mini Program OpenAPIs. If you do not find an error code in the following table, it means that the error code is not common, but dedicated to a specific OpenAPI (see the following [API-specific error codes](https://miniprogram.gcash.com/docs/miniprogram_gcash/mpdev-old/error_codes#yXcm4) section). | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **resultCode** | **resultMessage** | **resultStatus** | **Action to do** | | PROCESS\_FAIL | A general business failure occurred. Do not retry. | F | Human intervention is usually needed. It is recommendeded that you contact Mini Program Technical Support to troubleshoot the issue. | | PARAM\_ILLEGAL | Illegal parameters. For example, non-numeric input, invalid date. | F | Check and verify whether the request fields (including the header fields and body fields) of the current API are correct and valid.
For details, see the specific API specification, for example, [the `applyToken` API specification](https://miniprogram.gcash.com/docs/miniprogram_gcash/mpdev-old/v2_applytoken#Q7yo9). | | INVALID\_API | The called API is invalid or not active. | F | Check whether the current API name is used by mistakes when the API is called. | | ACCESS\_DENIED | Access is denied | F | Need to check the `resultMessage` of the current API specification for details. For example, [the `applyToken` API specification](https://miniprogram.gcash.com/docs/miniprogram_gcash/mpdev-old/v2_applytoken#QiyKe). | | REQUEST\_TRAFFIC\_EXCEED\_LIMIT | The request traffic exceeds the limit. | F | - The party that calls APIs needs to reduce the API calling frequency, or
- The API service provider needs to increase the traffic limit or threshold. | | EXPIRED\_ACCESS\_TOKEN | The access token is expired. | F | Renew the access token by calling the `applyToken` API ( [`/v1/authorizations/applyToken`](https://miniprogram.gcash.com/docs/miniprogram_gcash/mpdev-old/qfd7r1) or [`/v2/authorizations/applyToken`](https://miniprogram.gcash.com/docs/miniprogram_gcash/mpdev-old/v2_applytoken)) | | UNKNOWN\_EXCEPTION | An API calling is failed, which is caused by unknown reasons. | U | Trying to re-call the API might help to resolve the issue. | # API-specific error codes For error codes that are dedicated to a specific API, see the **Result** section in each API specification, for example , [the `applyToken` API specification](https://miniprogram.gcash.com/docs/miniprogram_gcash/mpdev-old/v2_applytoken#jbcZ9). 九色鹿
